newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai sugar cane crushing end, output below target.
newsitem.headline: Thai sugar cane crushing end, output below target.

text.p: Thai sugar mills completed the crushing for the 1996/97 season while only seven of 46 mills were still operating on the remelting programme, an official from the industry ministry said on Friday.
The preliminary figure showed that overall production trailed behind that of last year with only 56.19 million tonnes of sugar cane crushed compared to 57.26 million tonnes during the last season.
"This is a preliminary figure which will be revised soon," said the official. The Thai sugar crushing season normally starts in November and ends in late May or early June.
As of May 14, Thai mills produced 5.79 million tonnes of sugar (tel quel) compared with 5.98 million tonnes during the same period last year.
This season's cane crushing details compared with the same period last season were as follows, (in tonnes unless otherwise specified):
